required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Post-Marketing Surveillance Study To Observe INLYTA® Treatment Dosing Pattern, Safety And Effectiveness In Taiwan Real World Routine Practice
clinical_study.official_title: Post-marketing Surveillance Study To Observe Inlyta (Registered) Treatment Dosing Pattern, Safety And Effectiveness In Taiwan Real World Routine Practice

brief_summary.textblock: This is a post-marketing Surveillance study to observe INLYTA® treatment dosing pattern, safety and effectiveness in Taiwan real world routine practice. The primary objective of this registry is to monitor the dose adjustment of INLYTA® in real world routine practice. The secondary objectives include safety profile, objective response rate, and progression-free rate in real world routine practice.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a multi-center chart review registry on mRCC patients treated with axitinib. Primary objective is the dose adjustment. Secondary objectives are safety profile, objective response rate and progression free survival. Efficacy assessment will be based on investigators' judgment. Patients treated with 1st dose of axitinib between May 7, 2013 and June 30, 2015 will be enrolled. The follow-up time is 12 months. Prior therapies should include sunitinib or interferon alpha.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of axitinib treatment up to the end of the study (up to 40 months)
From initiation of axitinib treatment up to the end of the study (up to 40 months)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of axitinib treatment until PD or death from any cause (up to 40 months)
secondary_outcome.description: ORR was defined as percentage of participants with confirmed complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) according to response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. CR was defined as disappearance of all target, non-target lesions and all lymph nodes decreased to non-pathological in size (less than [<]10 millimeter [mm] short axis). PR was defined as at least 30 percent (%) decrease in sum of diameters of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum, without progression of non-target lesions, no appearance of new lesions. Progression of disease (PD) was defined as greater than equal to (>=) 20% increase in sum of diameters of the target lesions taking as reference the smallest sum on study (this included the baseline sum if that was the smallest on study) or unequivocal progression in non-target lesions or appearance of 1 or more new lesions. Response evaluation was based on investigators' judgment.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of axitinib treatment until PD or death from any cause (up to 40 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of response was defined as time from first documentation of objective tumor response (CR or PR), that was subsequently confirmed, to the first documentation of PD or to death due to any cause, whichever occurred first as per RECIST version 1.1. CR was defined as disappearance of all target, non-target lesions and all lymph nodes decreased to non-pathological in size (<10 mm short axis). PR was defined as at least 30% decrease in sum of diameters of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum, without progression of non-target lesions, no appearance of new lesions. PD was defined as >=20% increase in sum of diameters of the target lesions taking as a reference smallest sum on study (this included the baseline sum if that was the smallest on study) or unequivocal progression in non-target lesions or appearance of 1 or more new lesions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of axitinib treatment until PD or death from any cause (up to 40 months)
secondary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time duration in months from start of study treatment to the first documentation of PD or to death due to any cause, whichever occured first. PD was assessed by RECIST version 1.1. and defined as >=20% increase in the sum of the diameters of the target lesions taking as a reference the smallest sum on study (this included the baseline sum if that was the smallest on study) or unequivocal progression in non-target lesions or the appearance of 1 or more new lesions. Progression free survival based on investigators' judgment on medical records was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of axitinib treatment up to end of the study (up to 40 months)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life- threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. A treatment-emergent AE was defined as an event that emerged during the treatment period that was absent before treatment, or worsened during the treatment period relative to the pretreatment state. AEs included both serious and non--serious events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) by Severity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of axitinib treatment up to end of the study (up to 40 months)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. Severity of the AEs was graded according to the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.0. Grade 1= mild; Grade 2= moderate; Grade 3= severe; Grade 4= life-threatening or disabling; Grade 5= death related to AE.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Related Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of axitinib treatment up to end of the study (up to 40 months)
secondary_outcome.description: A treatment-related AE was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to study drug in a participant who received study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Discontinued Due to Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of axitinib treatment up to end of the study (up to 40 months)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship.

study_pop.textblock: advanced renal cell carinoma with disease progression on sunitinib or interferon

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients diagnosed as advanced RCC by histology or cytology
- Patients using axitinib as therapy after failure of sunitinib or cytokine
- Patients received axitinib treatment and follow up in the health care center participating present registry
- Patients agree to participate and signed inform consent or IRB waiving of signed informed consent document is available
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with first dose of axitinib earlier than 7th May 2013
- Patients with first dose of axitinib later than 30th June 2015.
- Patients participating in clinical research involving axitinib
- Patients with hypersensitivity to axitinib or to any other component of axitinib
- Patients under 18-year of age
- Pregnant women.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

clinical_study.keyword: advanced renal cell carcinoma, disease progression, sunitinib, interferon alpha

group.title: Axitinib (INLYTA)
group.description: Participants diagnosed with advanced renal cell carcinoma (RCC) and received axitinib therapy as per routine clinical practice according to the label-packaging-dosing (LPD) under the physician's prescription were observed for 40 months.

baseline.population: Safety population included all the enrolled participants who received at least one dose of the axitinib.

measure.title: Objective Response Rate (ORR)
measure.description: ORR was defined as percentage of participants with confirmed complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) according to response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. CR was defined as disappearance of all target, non-target lesions and all lymph nodes decreased to non-pathological in size (less than [<]10 millimeter [mm] short axis). PR was defined as at least 30 percent (%) decrease in sum of diameters of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum, without progression of non-target lesions, no appearance of new lesions. Progression of disease (PD) was defined as greater than equal to (>=) 20% increase in sum of diameters of the target lesions taking as reference the smallest sum on study (this included the baseline sum if that was the smallest on study) or unequivocal progression in non-target lesions or appearance of 1 or more new lesions. Response evaluation was based on investigators' judgment.
measure.population: Efficacy population included all the participants who were enrolled in the study.

outcome.title: Duration of Response
outcome.description: Duration of response was defined as time from first documentation of objective tumor response (CR or PR), that was subsequently confirmed, to the first documentation of PD or to death due to any cause, whichever occurred first as per RECIST version 1.1. CR was defined as disappearance of all target, non-target lesions and all lymph nodes decreased to non-pathological in size (<10 mm short axis). PR was defined as at least 30% decrease in sum of diameters of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum, without progression of non-target lesions, no appearance of new lesions. PD was defined as >=20% increase in sum of diameters of the target lesions taking as a reference smallest sum on study (this included the baseline sum if that was the smallest on study) or unequivocal progression in non-target lesions or appearance of 1 or more new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: From initiation of axitinib treatment until PD or death from any cause (up to 40 months)
outcome.population: Efficacy population included all the participants who were enrolled in the study. Here 'number of participants analyzed' signifies participants who achieved a confirmed CR or PR.

group.description: Participants diagnosed with advanced RCC and received axitinib therapy as per routine clinical practice according to the LPD under the physician's prescription were observed for 40 months.

measure.title: Duration of Response
measure.description: Duration of response was defined as time from first documentation of objective tumor response (CR or PR), that was subsequently confirmed, to the first documentation of PD or to death due to any cause, whichever occurred first as per RECIST version 1.1. CR was defined as disappearance of all target, non-target lesions and all lymph nodes decreased to non-pathological in size (<10 mm short axis). PR was defined as at least 30% decrease in sum of diameters of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum, without progression of non-target lesions, no appearance of new lesions. PD was defined as >=20% increase in sum of diameters of the target lesions taking as a reference smallest sum on study (this included the baseline sum if that was the smallest on study) or unequivocal progression in non-target lesions or appearance of 1 or more new lesions.
measure.population: Efficacy population included all the participants who were enrolled in the study. Here 'number of participants analyzed' signifies participants who achieved a confirmed CR or PR.

measurement_list.measurement: Upper and lower limits of 95% confidence interval were not estimable since only 1 participant had event and analyzed for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time duration in months from start of study treatment to the first documentation of PD or to death due to any cause, whichever occured first. PD was assessed by RECIST version 1.1. and defined as >=20% increase in the sum of the diameters of the target lesions taking as a reference the smallest sum on study (this included the baseline sum if that was the smallest on study) or unequivocal progression in non-target lesions or the appearance of 1 or more new lesions. Progression free survival based on investigators' judgment on medical records was calculated.
outcome.time_frame: From initiation of axitinib treatment until PD or death from any cause (up to 40 months)
outcome.population: Efficacy population included all the participants who were enrolled in the study.

measure.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
measure.description: PFS was defined as the time duration in months from start of study treatment to the first documentation of PD or to death due to any cause, whichever occured first. PD was assessed by RECIST version 1.1. and defined as >=20% increase in the sum of the diameters of the target lesions taking as a reference the smallest sum on study (this included the baseline sum if that was the smallest on study) or unequivocal progression in non-target lesions or the appearance of 1 or more new lesions. Progression free survival based on investigators' judgment on medical records was calculated.
measure.population: Efficacy population included all the participants who were enrolled in the study.

measurement_list.measurement: The upper limit of 95% confidence interval was not reached at the time of data cut-off.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life­ threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. A treatment-emergent AE was defined as an event that emerged during the treatment period that was absent before treatment, or worsened during the treatment period relative to the pretreatment state. AEs included both serious and non-­serious events.
outcome.time_frame: From initiation of axitinib treatment up to end of the study (up to 40 months)
outcome.population: Safety population included all the enrolled participants who received at least one dose of the axitinib.

A treatment-emergent AE was defined as an event that emerged during the treatment period that was absent before treatment, or worsened during the treatment period relative to the pretreatment state. outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) by Severity
outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. Severity of the AEs was graded according to the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.0. Grade 1= mild; Grade 2= moderate; Grade 3= severe; Grade 4= life-threatening or disabling; Grade 5= death related to AE.
outcome.time_frame: From initiation of axitinib treatment up to end of the study (up to 40 months)
outcome.population: Safety population included all the enrolled participants who received at least one dose of the axitinib. Here 'number of participants analyzed' signifies participants evaluable for this outcome measure.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one participant and as non-serious in another participant, or one participant may have experienced both a serious and non-serious event during the study.

group.title: Axitinib (INLYTA)
group.description: Participants diagnosed with advanced RCC and received axitinib therapy as per routine clinical practice according to the LPD under the physician's prescription were observed for 40 months.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
